title: Jobs
text:
Home Subscribe Jobs 
Scroll.in is an independent news, information, and entertainment venture. Our first offering is a newsfeed that brings into sharp focus the most important political and cultural stories that are shaping contemporary India www.scroll.in . We have also partnered with Atlantic Media Company to launch Quartz India, a digitally native newsfeed for business people in the new global economy www.qz.com/india . 
Scroll is powered by a growing team of enthusiastic newshounds, culturists, and tech aficionados from MIT, Harvard, Columbia, Dartmouth, McKinsey, The Wall Street Journal, The Sunday Guardian, Yahoo, and more! 
If you're interested in joining our team, have a look at the openings below: Accounts Manager (Ad Sales) Explanatory/data Journalist (News Team) 
Scroll.in’s news team covers politics and current affairs in a quick, engaging and impartial manner. We are looking for a well-informed, talented journalist with strong analytical and writing skills to be part of the team. 
In particular, we are looking for a journalist who is comfortable writing quick, clean copy that can explain or add context to developing news stories, is comfortable with the basics of data journalism and is also interested in covering politics and policy. 
All journalists on the news team are expected to: Identify and understand news stories across a variety of subjects, including current affairs, politics and policy. Write quick, clean and balanced copies. Be aware of social media platforms and their potential as both sources of stories as well as distribution forums. Be able to work with senior editors and respond quickly to developing stories. 
In particular, the candidate we are looking for should, Have at least 2-3 years of experience as a reporter or editor in a news organisation. Have impeccable analytical and writing skills. Have a general grasp of a cross-section of news besides just politics – such as business, international, etc. 
Location: Delhi Contact: Interested applicants should send CV and cover letter to . Please reference “Explanatory/data Journalist (News Team)” in the subject line. Chief Copy Editor (News Desk) 
Scroll.in’s The Latest brings readers the top news in an elegant, closely curated newsfeed. We are looking for well-informed and talented journalists with very strong writing and editing skills to join us. 
The candidate will be responsible for: Identifying and curating the top news stories across various sections, such as politics, regional news, business/finance, international, features and so on. Writing and editing very quick, very clean, and very balanced copy. Coordinating stories with senior copy editors, which includes assigning and editing when necessary. Responding quickly to the news and to other Scroll teams as events change and stories develop. Managing aspects of production, such as sourcing images and social media elements, along with using appropriate SEO keywords. Being able to sift through biases in reporting while identifying, writing and editing copies. 
A candidate should: Have more than five years' experience in journalism (preferably on a news desk). Have impeccable writing, editing and proofreading skills. Possess a knowledge of news wire services and social media channels. Have a general grasp of a cross-section of news besides just politics – such as business, international, etc. 
Location: Mumbai or Delhi Contact: Interested applicants should send CV and cover letter to . Please reference “Chief copy editor (News Desk)” in the subject line. Social Media Manager, Scroll.in 
We are looking for a social media manager to work closely with our editorial team to ensure Scroll stories reach the right audiences on social media. The selected candidate will help build our social media strategy across different platforms to increase engagement and interaction with readers. 
Successful applicants should have experience in web editorial or a journalism background and must be able to demonstrate sound news judgment. Opportunities for growth in this position rest entirely on the candidate. Depending on performance, s/he may be able to shape the company's overall social media strategy. 
Candidates should: Have 2+ years experience publishing for and managing social media feeds for a news organisation or a brand, Possess impeccable news sense, editing, and proofreading skills, Be able to quickly conceive of, and write creative and relevant content for social media feeds, Have mastery of social media channels, including Facebook, Twitter, Google+, LinkedIn, and YouTube, and an understanding of various publishing formats, strategies and techniques used by social media teams across the globe, Be very knowledgeable of social media marketing and analytics tools such as Power Editor; knowledge of Qwaya is a major plus, Have basic knowledge of Adobe Photoshop, Google Analytics, Microsoft Excel and HTML, Be extremely efficient, detail-oriented, and passionate about the news, in particular political and cultural stories. 
Location: Mumbai/New Delhi, India Contact: Interested applicants should send CV and cover letter to . Please reference ‘Social media manager, Scroll.in’ in the subject line. Director of Marketing 
The Director of Marketing will own the company’s aggressive growth targets and develop the strategies to meet them. The Director should be relentless about forging partnerships and identifying new opportunities for Scroll to reach wider audiences. 
Specific responsibilities include, but aren't limited to: Working directly with the co-founders to develop a roadmap for meeting growth targets Overseeing current content marketing efforts and team, for both the web and app experience Aggressively pursuing strategic technical and content partnerships in India and abroad to help grow the Scroll audience Identifying various forums for Scroll to reach new users, such as events or festivals Developing and presenting monthly reports to the co-founders 
Desired Skills and Experience The ideal candidate will have: 8+ years experience in marketing with a top-tier tech, content, or publishing company Aggressive attitude towards growth and targets Strong analytical skills, and experience analyzing data (will be assessed) Excellent writing, communication, and presentation skills Ability to motivate and manage teams MBA from top-tier business school a major plus 
Location: Mumbai Contact: Interested applicants should send their CV and cover letter to . Please reference “Director of Marketing” in the subject line. Frontend Engineer 
Scroll is reinventing native ad solutions, and we’re looking for a Frontend Engineer with at least 1 year of experience to lead the development of one-of-a-kind designs to clients. Unlike traditional ads, we offer a unique, full-width format that resembles a blank canvas, upon which we can design actions, interactions, and messaging. Examples of our format include the following creatives: [1] , [2] , and [3] . 
Among other roles, the Frontend Engineer will be responsible for: Working with designers to understand elements of ad spec Independently developing ads for launch on Scroll’s properties QA’ing ads on staging site before final launch Constantly exploring new technologies to advance the interactivity and performance of the ads 
The ideal candidate should have: 1+ years of professional reporting experience be fluent in JavaScript have experience with any of the MV* JavaScript frameworks be experienced writing CSS/SASS have a flair for simple, elegant design have experience writing tests for code you write 
Location: Mumbai Contact: All interested candidates should submit a cover letter and resume to . Please reference “Frontend Engineer” in the subject line. Javascript Developer 
Help power the next generation of publishing by joining Scroll.in, a venture-backed digital media company focused on the intersection of editorial and technology. Our first offering is a digitally-native news publication, Scroll.in, which brings readers top political and cultural news in an elegant, responsive newsfeed. 
About the technology team 
Tech team is a bunch of fun loving geeks who love open source. We have built products and maintain open source projects that we are proud of. We provide Mac Air/Pro to all our developers. We have flexible office times. 
Now we are expanding and looking for a javascript developer with a passion for mobile technologies to design and build out our web and mobile applications. 
The javascript developer will be responsible for: Designing and building responsive web applications Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define, design, and push new features Unit-testing code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability Working on bug fixing and improving app performance Continuously discovering, evaluating, and implementing new technologies to maximize development efficiency 
The ideal candidate should have: Relevant development experience of at least 1 year Familiarity with version control system such as git A deep familiarity with HTML5, Javascript, CSS3
